matrix.adapterDistribution

Interface AdapterDistribution

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdapterDistributionJPPFImp

    public interface AdapterDistribution
extends java.io.Closeable
    AdapterDistribution defines the methods for executing an operation in a distributed fashion. Example of usage: 
     Matrix res = ...; //creates a matrix in which the result is reconstructed
 MatrixReconstructionStrategy strategy = ...; //Defines how tasks' results are combined
 AdapterDistribution adapter = ...;
 IDataShared dataShared = adapter.getDataShared();
 
 List tasks = getTasks(); // returns the task to be executed in the cluster
 
 adapter.createJob(tasks.size(), res, strategy):
 adapter.addTasks(tasks);
 adapter.submit();
 adapter.waitUntilComplete();
    After the method waitUntilComplete() returns the Matrix res should contain the reconstructed result of executing all tasks.
    Author:
    Antonela Tommasel

      IDataShared getDataShared()
      Gets the data shared mechanism.
      void submit()
      Executes the created job
      void waitUntilComplete()
      Blocks the execution of the current thread until all tasks are completed.

        void submit()
        Executes the created job

      • createJob

        void createJob(int taskNumber,
             Matrix res,
             MatrixReconstructionStrategy matrixReconstructionStrategy)
        Initialises the adapter to submit a new job, which comprises a set of tasks, to be executed in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        taskNumber - number of tasks in the job
        res - Matrix in which the result would be place
        matrixReconstructionStrategy - strategy for reducing the results of each task into a single result.

      • getDataShared

        IDataShared getDataShared()
        Gets the data shared mechanism.
        Returns:
        an instance of IDataShared for sharing data within the cluster.

      • waitUntilComplete

        void waitUntilComplete()
        Blocks the execution of the current thread until all tasks are completed.

        Closes the underline connection with the cluster.
